intro: Sideroxylon velutinum, commonly known as the velvet wood tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its thick, bark-like trunk and dense, leathery foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and its fruits are capsule-like structures containing numerous seeds. Sideroxylon velutinum is often found in dry, open woodlands and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitats.
